---
title: "SWIID Version 9.2 is available!"
author: Frederick Solt
date: '2021-12-22'
categories:
  - update
  - swiid
description: "Hi everyone! Version 9.3 of the SWIID is now available! This new release adds to its source data 3834 new Ginis since version 9.1..."
---

::: {.cell}

:::


Hi everyone! Version 9.3 of the SWIID is [now available](/swiid/swiid_downloads/)! This new release:

-   adds to [its source data](https://github.com/fsolt/swiid/blob/master/data/swiid_source.csv) 5139 new Ginis since version 9.2, including newly available LIS data on [Canada, France, Ireland, Mali, Norway, Uruguay, Poland](https://www.lisdatacenter.org/news-and-events/2022-spring-data-splash/), [Germany, Luxembourg, Mali (again!), Peru, and the United States](https://www.lisdatacenter.org/news-and-events/2022-summer-data-splash/); and

-   includes estimates of market and disposable income inequality for 62 more country-years than version 9.2.


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/plot-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/highest-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


For more details, you can check out the all the R and Stan code used to generate the estimates [in the SWIID GitHub repository](https://github.com/fsolt/swiid). As always, I encourage users of the SWIID to [email me](mailto:frederick-solt@uiowa.edu) with their comments, questions, and suggestions.
